title.rendered: Vantage Markets’ New Episode Explores the Space Economy

content.rendered:
Vantage Markets has launched its fourth episode of The Vantage View, created in partnership with Bloomberg Media Studios.

The Future of the Space Economy

“The Future of the Space Economy” delves into the growth and investment opportunities in the space economy, hosted by Simon Gwozdz, CEO & Founder of Equatorial Space Systems, a leading figure in the industry.

Satellite Data and Space Mining Projections

In this episode, Simon Gwozdz discusses the potential for high returns despite longer investment periods, the democratization of space, and the rise of space tourism and resource prospecting. The episode highlights projections for significant growth: the Satellite Data Services Market is expected to reach £25.3 billion by 2030, and the Space Mining Market is forecasted to hit £12.1 billion by 2037.

David Shayer, CEO of Vantage UK, commented, “We are pleased to introduce the latest episode of The Vantage View, focusing on the future of the space economy. Understanding the dynamics and emerging investment potentials in the space industry is crucial for our clients and stakeholders.”

Previous Episodes of The Vantage View

Vantage Markets, a multi-asset broker offering access to CFDs on Forex, Commodities, Indices, Shares, ETFs, and Bonds, has been releasing The Vantage View episodes for several months.

The third episode centered on sustainable mobility, especially the electrification of transportation in Asia, highlighting investment opportunities within the EV supply chain, including raw materials, battery technology, and charging infrastructure, showcasing Asia’s evolving electric mobility landscape.

In January, an episode on the circular economy featured Dr. Seeram Ramakrishna, Professor and Director at the Centre for Nanotechnology and Sustainability, National University of Singapore. Dr. Ramakrishna compared the traditional linear economy with the circular economy, emphasizing the latter’s societal benefits and how the financial sector is adopting circular practices to diversify and reduce long-term risks. The episode also offered insights for retail investors on contributing to the circular economy.

In Q3 2023, Vantage announced the production of “The Vantage View” in collaboration with Bloomberg Media Studios. The video series aims to provide authoritative opinions and expert commentary quarterly, covering various pressing political-economic issues, including the geopolitical impact of climate change policies and the role of technological innovations like Artificial Intelligence in financial markets. The series is designed to be a go-to resource for investors, professionals, and anyone interested in the complexities of the global economic landscape.
